description: This file implements provisioning functions for the Sys Ctlv Processor Object, primarily focusing on populating system configuration repositories from CTLV data buffers, handling creation of folders, and adding various types of records into a system repository.

classes.name: SYS_CTLV_PROCESSOR_OBJECT
classes.description: The main object for handling CTLV processing, containing handler references like 'hSysIraIf' which interfaces with the system repository.

classes.name: SYS_IRA_INTERFACE
classes.description: Interface providing methods to add folders, add records, and close folders within the system repository.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SysCpoProvisionFolder(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hParentFolder,PUCHAR pCtlvBuffer,ULONG ulCtlvSize)
methods.description: Main function to populate system repository folders and records from CTLV data buffer, creating subfolders and adding various record types based on the CTLV tuples.
